file_content.text: Child! What's this bloodshed in my grave?
I warned you not to summon me again! I warned you to leave me in peace! To keep your Jedi away from my grave!
Please, I'm sorry. This Sith needed to speak with you.
Your apology is worthless! You must die.
She only summoned you because I asked her to.
It's me you want. [Calm him]
No. [Calm him]
[Let the ghost kill Ashara]
Wait. Please don't kill me. Don't let him kill me! I'll do whatever you say!
Since you begged.
Fine. [Calm ghost]
I've been waiting to hear those words for a long time.
Finally. [Calm ghost]
Agree to be my apprentice and I will spare you.
You must join me.
Whatever you say.
What is happening? What are you....
Strange. How long has it been since I've felt at peace? Centuries at least.
What do you want that you went through all this effort to speak to me?
I need your strength.
Power. [Bind him]
I wish to devour you and take your power for my own.
I hunger. [Bind him]
If you will let me bind you, I promise to free you when my enemies are defeated.
I need your help.
Will it get me out of this accursed enclave, with its artifacts of the light? Then I accept.
Seal the pact with blood, Sith, and my power is yours.
The pact is sealed.
I promise. [Seal pact]
I will remember your generosity.
Thank you. [Seal pact]
My strength is yours, Sith. Use it well.
I'd rather have all of your strength.
Forget it. [Force him]
Ha. You don't have the ability to overwhelm me--aggghhh!
Sith, what did you just do?
I took the power that was rightfully mine.
I bound the ghost.
The only way I could think to free the enclave was to bind the ghost to myself.
I cleansed the enclave.
If I hadn't done that, another Sith like Maliss would have come and claimed it for himself.
Only what was necessary.
What happens now?
I am your master now.
Bow to me.
I don't know. I guess I can't return to the Jedi after this, can I?
Help me use my power to serve the light.
Let's redeem the Empire.
Go away.
Are you kidding? How will I answer for my Masters? For the ghost?
You manipulate me for your own ends and then you leave? My life as a Jedi is over.
You'll always have a place at my side.
Then come with me.
I don't have a choice, do I?
The Jedi were only holding you back. You wanted to cleanse this place, and you did. Come with me, and I'll help you realize your full potential.
Forget the Jedi.
Fine, I'll come. But I won't go against the Jedi teachings.
I think I can solve that problem. Join me. Become Sith.
You're my apprentice now.
Aggghhh!
Please, no more. I'll follow you. Just, no more, you monster.
No offense, my lord, but I've seen actual tombs that had fewer dead in them than this place.
There's the easy way, the hard way and then there's your way....
So much death, my master. Your servant feasts well today.
If this bloody scene is any indication, riding in your mind will be great fun, Sith.
You killed them! You killed the Masters!
They are Jedi after all.
It's what Sith do.
Just summon the ghost now.
Bring me the ghost.
Just bring me my ghost!
I'm sorry, but they gave me no choice. They attacked me.
It was self-defense.
I guess there's nothing left to do now but summon the ghost.
Child, I thought I told you never to summon me again!
Excellent. Truly remarkable. My lord, you are utterly clever and resourceful.
Thank you so much for clearing out the Jedi for us.
I didn't do it for you.
Don't thank me.
Ah, but you did.
Maliss!
Collecting a ghost. For my master.
If this is what I think it is, know that I don't take kindly to betrayal.
Don't do something stupid.
I'm sorry it had to end this way, but you were dead, and Darth Thanaton made a better offer. He's made me a lord.
Unfortunately, he's also asked that you be executed. My regrets.
There she is. The Sith who wants the ghost.
There he is. The Sith who wants the ghost.
You were right to tell us, Ashara. The Jedi Enclave is no place for Sith, and this one gives me an uneasy feeling.
I've made mistakes in the past, it's true. But I mean well now.
Let me redeem myself.
Please, I believe I can cleanse the enclave of the ghost.
I just want to help.
We've been trying for months to cleanse this enclave.
No, it doesn't work that way, Sith.
We are the sworn defenders of this enclave, and we will not have dark side rituals performed in it.
Blame it on my misspent youth.
I had a rough childhood.
This is not a flippant matter. I won't have dark side rituals performed in this enclave!
Please! I relent. Lord, Jedi, don't kill me.
Of course. The Jedi way is mercy.
He will gather more men and keep hunting you. His master will kill him if he fails.
That's not wise.
Master Ryen says, "Mercy has risk." It wouldn't be mercy otherwise.
You know this one would not show you mercy, but go ahead. Be the good Padawan. Obey your Masters.
Think for yourself.
Shut up. Shut up! Why do you care whether he lives or dies?
You call it mercy, but you're too afraid to kill.
I knew you Jedi were cowards.
He's surrendered. There's no courage in killing a helpless man. Why do you care whether he lives or dies?
He's just another worthless Sith. He doesn't deserve his life.
Why do you?
No, he doesn't. But the same could be said of you, and I won't be goaded.
He chased you like an animal through the swamp, and you let him live?
He tried to kill you!
I am giving you an order.
Kill him. [Shock her]
Because I want to see you kill, and I want to see you enjoy it!
Enough talk! [Shock her]
Kill him. [Shock her]
Agghhh!
I won't do it, Sith. I won't do it.
You can end the pain. All you have to do is kill him.
You will. [Shock her]
Aggghhh!
Why suffer for someone you hate?
Don't be stupid. [Shock her]
Aggghhh!
A Jedi doesn't hate....
He dies either way. You can make it quick for him.
He suffers too. [Shock him]
Aggghhh!
Please, girl. There's no reasoning with him.
Please, girl. There's no reasoning with her.
I'm sorry. Please forgive me. "There is no death, only the Force."
Aggghhh!
You have quite the talent.
Marvelous.
Please, don't say that.
It feels good, doesn't it?
Did you like that?
Yes, yes it does. I feel so powerful. No, that's not what I meant.
Your true nature finally shows.
Just like a Sith.
No, this isn't me. You made me. This isn't me.
The Jedi won't have me back now. Not after what I've done. What will I do?
Join me as my apprentice.
Become Sith.
I don't really have a choice, do I?
Your emotions are a powerful weapon. Embrace them.
Don't deny your strength.
The Jedi told me to put my emotions aside. Do they know what this feels like?
You will suffer until you learn to obey.
Call me master. [Shock her]
Aggghhh!
I am not a Jedi.
No. [Kill him]
Aggghhh!
You even kill your own kind without remorse. What do you want with me anyway?
You heard the girl.
Thank you, Sith. I didn't think mercy was in the Sith vocabulary.
Sith! I should have known.
Don't think you can kill me easily because I'm a Padawan. Even Master Ocera can't beat me with a lightsaber.
Here's the holocron, as promised.
It's no trap.
A Sith who keeps his word. Now I've seen everything.
A Sith who keeps her word. Now I've seen everything.
Such intensity. Such fire. Those are Sith qualities.
Such passion.
Jedi are not without emotions, but they channel them toward the greater good and the protection of others.
You couldn't beat me if I was wielding a toothpick.
Don't be a fool.
You'll have to try harder if you want to pick a fight. A Jedi never draws first.
Is that the holocron? You surprise me, Sith. I didn't think you people knew how to tell the truth.
Strange. I've never held one of these before. I expected it to be heavier.
They are remarkable objects. Care to have a look inside?
It does spark the curiosity.
I don't know. The Masters don't let Padawans handle holocrons.
They also didn't want you coming here, but it worked out.
They don't let you do a lot.
Well, I guess it can't hurt to look?
It's probably more than you can handle anyway.
They're wise.
Why is everyone always trying to tell me what I can handle?
There's much a Padawan can learn from a holocron.
Why not?
And I'm sure I will learn all those things in time. But for now, I must take this holocron to the Masters.
You may take it to your Masters, but I need you to do something for me in return.
Now, what will you give me?
That depends on what you ask. I won't go against my training.
You must promise not to open it. It feels light, but its power would certainly overwhelm a Padawan.
It's deceptive.
So even you look down your nose at me. I'm no ordinary Padawan, Sith.
Then use the holocron.
Prove it.
I will. Just to show you. I will.
I didn't mean you, of course.
Apologies.
I know what you meant. I'll show you.
Behold the teachings of Darth Angral, Lord of the Sith!
"Peace is a lie, there is only passion." "Peace is a lie, there is only passion." "Peace is a lie, there is only passion."
I need to see the ghost in the Jedi Enclave.
Your ancestor....
I need access to the Jedi Enclave.
About the Jedi Enclave....
Why? Wait--you're after the ghost. I should've known. Everyone wants to see that stupid ghost.
No. No Sith can enter the Jedi Enclave. What would you do with a ghost anyway?
The ghost in the Jedi Enclave. I must speak with him.
I believe you know a ghost....
The ghost? No. No Sith can enter the Jedi Enclave. What do you want with him anyway?
My master wants me dead. I need the ghost's help to defeat him.
I have no choice.
But, there's no ritual that can get this ghost to aid you.
The Masters would have learned to pacify it by now if it was possible. What makes you think you can get its help?
There are Sith who want that ghost, but I think I can drive him away.
To cleanse the enclave.
Even the Masters haven't figured out how to drive the ghost away.
I saved your life. You could do this much for me.
You owe me.
That holocron alone will warrant you passing your trials. I think you could give me something in return.
You owe me.
What does that have to do with anything? The Masters are here specifically to protect that ghost from Sith.
Even if I let you in, what would you do? The ghost is angry, implacable. Even the Masters don't know how to pacify it.
This isn't something I tell everyone. I have dreams, I see things.
I had a vision.
I've dreamt that I will pacify the ghost. I don't know how or why, only that it's my destiny.
I know an ancient technique used to pacify ghosts. It requires great sacrifice.
I learned a ritual....
I don't know if the ritual will succeed, but I must try.
Why so intent on keeping me from the ghost? If your Masters can't tame it, what harm could I possibly do?
What's the harm?
The Masters have guarded the enclave with good reason, I think.
Let them see when you summon the ghost. I promise, no harm will come to them.
Then invite the Masters.
They would easily overpower you if you tried anything. We have a deal.
I will go prepare the enclave and inform the Masters.
Always deferring to the Masters. I thought this was your ancestor.
The Masters again!
He is my ancestor. I suppose there's no harm in letting you just speak with him.
If you will not let me speak with this ghost, I will be killed, and my blood will be on your hands.
Then I am as good as dead.
Fine. You may see the ghost. But whether or not he speaks to you is beyond my control.
I'll go ahead and prepare the enclave, make sure no Jedi are around.
This holocron is an evil object. If you can't be trusted with it....
Don't be stupid.
No. You can trust me. I will deliver it, unopened, to the Masters.
I'm not sure they will approve, but I feel like I ought to give you something, as a "thank you" for the holocron?
All right, Sith. I came. But no tricks.
Sith. I came like you asked. No tricks, right? You really want to come over to the light?
Just tell me what I must do to become a Jedi.
Yes. Help me.
Well, um, it doesn't really work that way.
I can teach you about the Jedi Order? And the code. But only the Jedi Council can decide to admit someone to the order.
I must become a Jedi. It's my only hope.
Don't turn me away.
Listen, I can put in a good word for you with my Masters, but that's all.
Even if I said "sure, you can be a Jedi," it wouldn't make you one. Understand?
Then at least take this holocron. It has an ill effect on me.
Don't leave the holocron.
Perhaps you can help me with something else, then.
I need your assistance.
I will try, but I won't go against my training.
In that case, I have no choice but to make you Sith.
Then you must join me. [Shock]
Please, I want to learn.
Well, there's the Jedi Code, which goes "There is no emotion, there is only peace."
But nowadays, the order will let people marry with permission.
So then I don't have to whisk you away in a grand romantic gesture.
[Flirt] What a relief.
What? Don't I rate a grand romantic gesture?
Old men deciding who and whether a girl can marry. How barbaric.
Ugh.
There are women on the Council, too.
Don't you ever feel... trapped?
Seems like a lot of rules.
N--no. Well, I mean, doesn't everybody feel trapped sometimes?
It's no wonder you Jedi are always falling. Being a Jedi is boring.
Yawn.
It might seem that way from the outside. But we're also soldiers, fighting for the protection of the galaxy.
Look, it's getting late. The Masters will wonder where I am.
If you must leave, please take this holocron from me. I'm afraid to have it.
Don't leave the holocron.
I am your master now. You're not going anywhere.
Stay. [Shock her]
Aggghhh!
No, please, stop! I'll never become Sith!
You don't need to listen to them.
Who cares about them?
I do. They're my Masters. That's part of being a Jedi. We obey our Masters, even if we don't want to.
Please take this holocron from me. Spare me its darkness.
You must take the holocron.
Yes, of course.
The truth is, I need your help for other reasons.
Not exactly.
What do you mean? What reasons?
You are going to do everything I say. Now listen closely...
Don't be stupid. [Shock her]
Aaagh! I won't do it. I won't help you.
Sith! I should have known this was some kind of trap.
You don't really intend to protect me against your own people!
Normally I wouldn't, but I need you alive.
Unusual, but true.
That certainly fills me with hope and confidence.
They took me out of slavery and forced me into this. It wasn't my choice.
They are not my people.
I--I'm sorry. I didn't, I didn't know the Sith did that. I guess I thought... I don't know what I thought.
Surely the idea of Sith opposing other Sith isn't surprising to you?
What do you expect from Sith?
No, now that you mention it, I guess it's not so unusual for villains to be at each other's throats.
With all respect, my lord, we have orders to see this girl dead. Please don't make a fuss.
If you want this Padawan, you'll have to go through me, first.
I hope you're ready to fight.
Don't make a fuss? You're asking too much, I'm afraid.
I always make trouble.
Wait, my lord, you're not seriously going to... I thought--this is treachery! Lord Anathemos will hear of it!
You heard him. We're not going down without a fight!
You heard her. We're not going down without a fight!
This is not the Padawan you're looking for.
[Force Persuade] Go away.
This is not the Padawan we're looking for. I'm sorry for the mistake, my lord. Come, men. Let's go.
Is that it? I mean, I guess I was expecting more blood.
I don't understand. Why did you go through all this trouble to save me?
I'm interested in the ghost in the Jedi enclave.
I'm hunting the dead.
You know how to raise the ghost in the Jedi enclave.
You have a special talent.
I need a new apprentice. You're it.
To make you Sith. [Shock her]
Ashara Zavros? I heard about the ambush. Meet me in the swamps, near your position. I can protect you.
What? Who are you? How do I know this isn't another trap?
If I wanted you dead, I'd just wait for the assassins to catch you and kill you.
I could let you die....
Maybe I should be worried about who it is that wants me alive so badly.
I'm a friend. That's all you need to know.
Trust me.
I don't really have a choice, do I?
You don't have much choice, do you?
You don't.
All right, I'll come that way. But if this is a trap, don't think I'll go down without a fight.
Ashara Zavros? I've discovered an item that I believe might be of interest to you. A holocron of some power.
Who are you? How did you know my name? What makes you think I'm interested in a holocron?
I'm trying to keep this holocron out of Sith hands.
The Sith want it.
The truth is, I'm a Sith, and I need your help.
I have a confession to make.
A Sith? How did you get this frequency? Stay away, or I'll cut you in two.
I believe we can help each other.
I mean you no harm.
I don't need your help.
I'm not overly familiar with the Jedi Code, but I don't remember the part about bisecting people.
That's not very Jedi-like.
If driving villains like you from the galaxy isn't what a Jedi does, I don't know what is.
I want nothing to do with you or your dark side secrets. Or that holocron.
I'm trying to turn away from the dark side, but I need help.
I'm trying to turn light side.
Why come to me? Why not go to one of the Masters? Ryen or Ocera?
I've done terrible things. I'm not ready to face their judgment.
I'm afraid.
I'm sure my Masters will be merciful.
The Sith on Taris have already learned of your devotion to the light. You were the first person I thought of.
I didn't know where to turn.
My Masters are also devoted to the light.
You are not a fool like your Masters.
I don't respect them.
My Masters are wise men.
They live the Jedi Code and protect the innocent. They will know what's best for you.
Perhaps if I had your reassurance, in person. We Sith do not trust easily.
Just meet with me. Please?
You can trust me, Sith. Tell me where I should meet you.
If they know what's best, why is their brightest disciple still a Padawan?
They haven't made you a Jedi.
I don't know. That's--that's their judgment to make.
But it's okay, I can help you. Where can I find you?
Please, help me get rid of this holocron. I'm losing my fight to resist it.
I need you to save me.
Okay, okay. I'll help you. Just tell me where you are.
Holocrons are incredible sources of knowledge. Jedi value knowledge, don't they?
What's wrong about a holocron?
"There is no ignorance. There is only knowledge." But some knowledge is too dangerous for Padawans.
Why call me? Why not take this holocron to one of the Masters? Ryen or Ocera?
They'll destroy it. I hate seeing knowledge destroyed.
I don't trust them.
I can't believe they'd destroy it. The Masters value knowledge.
Aren't you a Jedi? Why should you have to defer to them?
Do they really know better?
I, well, yes, I am a Jedi.
I've already heard stories of your knowledge and power.
Your reputation precedes you.
Stories? That, I don't believe. The Masters don't seem to think I have much power or knowledge.
But even if I was interested, I shouldn't leave the base....
You don't really do everything your Masters tell you, do you?
Are you afraid?
Obedience is the Jedi way. But then, there are always exceptions.
This is your chance to show your Masters that you're worthy of handling such a delicate item.
They don't trust you, do they?
You're right. I can prove myself.
I'll come. Just tell me where to meet you.
The swamps near Republic territory.
There's an enclave....
I'm sending you the coordinates of an enclave in the swamps.
I'll send you the location.
Are you familiar with this area of the swamps, near the Republic base?
Do you know the swamps?
Yes, I know the place. I'll meet you there as soon as I can. If they ask, I'll tell my Masters I've gone to train.
I'll be waiting at the swamps in Republic territory, if you change your mind.
Give it some thought.
I'll... I'll give it some thought.
I'm sorry, Sith. I couldn't do what you said. I just couldn't.
This is all my fault. I should have known better than to deal with a Sith.
Fine, I'll come.
Embrace the dark side. Come with me.
You become Sith.
I suppose after all this, that's the only path open to me. Masters, forgive me.
You tried to turn me to the dark side, and you have the nerve to claim self-defense?
Master Ryen. Master Ocera. What have I done? What have I done?
I understand you're upset, but we have a ghost to deal with.
You're right. There is no emotion. There's peace.
You said you would make sure there were no Jedi!
You betrayed me.
I'm sorry. I couldn't. I'm not dark side...
I-- I suppose you're right. What kind of Jedi would I be if I let this assassin kill again? Please forgive me.
You will end this miserable wretch's life before he kills again.
[Force Persuade] Kill him.
I will end this miserable wretch's life before he kills again.
The darkness feels good, but the Order, the teachings... I don't know. What do you want from me?
The fear, the anger, the pain. I relent! What do you want from me?
The ghost! But... no, of course. I will do as you say.
No. What am I saying? Is that what the darkness feels like?
Embrace it.
Leave the Jedi.
It feels good. It feels powerful.... No! I should never have used the holocron! I can feel its darkness in me.
Don't resist. [Shock her]
